channel.title: Attack option only in wilderness? - 317 Delta
channel.description:
So, I have my server going etc ;) Basically, players have the attack option, how can I make it so they can only attack in wild?
Please don't suggest removing that, I already tried, it removes the option everywhere.
Attack thing: [code=java]outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); // command slot (does it matter which one?) outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("Attack"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();[/code]

item.title: Attack option only in wilderness? - 317 Delta
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

Grave Digging Threads… Well done.

Read full topic
item.source: Attack option only in wilderness? - 317 Delta

item.title: Attack option only in wilderness? - 317 Delta
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Tatemo, post:7, topic:384795”]outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); // command slot (does it matter which one?) outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu if (inWilderness(Or whatever your thing is)) outStream.writeString("Attack"); else outStream.writeString("null"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();

Was it really that hard?

EDIT: I almost feel bad for helping you after reading your replies. Matzie explained it very well and just because you are too stupid to understand just makes you unworthy of understanding.[/quote]

granted, if he is a beginer at coding mine wasn’t the best filler. i actually found the answer to this question on google for myself the same day ~_~ so its not like he was short of resources, or access, just short of willpower to find the answer.

Read full topic
item.source: Attack option only in wilderness? - 317 Delta

item.title: Attack option only in wilderness? - 317 Delta
item.dc:creator: @SGTCannon SGTCannon
item.description:
@SGTCannon wrote:

[quote=“Tatemo, post:9, topic:384795”]Have you checked you don’t also have this added somewhere else as well?

And have you also checked that the code works at all? Try changing attack to something like spank and see if it changes. If it does then there is no reason that shouldn’t work. Otherwise you need to get some new code/check it is in the right place etc. You need to make sure this is being checked in process or in the walking packet. Better to put it in the walking packet.[/quote]

Like, I had tried something similar earlier, I must have just missed something.

Thank you!

Read full topic
item.source: Attack option only in wilderness? - 317 Delta

item.title: Attack option only in wilderness? - 317 Delta
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Have you checked you don’t also have this added somewhere else as well?

And have you also checked that the code works at all? Try changing attack to something like spank and see if it changes. If it does then there is no reason that shouldn’t work. Otherwise you need to get some new code/check it is in the right place etc. You need to make sure this is being checked in process or in the walking packet. Better to put it in the walking packet.

Read full topic

item.title: Attack option only in wilderness? - 317 Delta
item.dc:creator: @SGTCannon SGTCannon
item.description:
@SGTCannon wrote:

[quote=“gravenfire23, post:5, topic:384795”][quote author=SGTCannon link=topic=480557.msg3518534#msg3518534 date=1299204594]

State base of server before you ask for help or you are going to get random answers for a whole buch of bases than what you need…

title says 317 delta
and…
all of them are the same O_O because its data sent to the client :\

as to the question. i know how 2 do it and its in my source. it has to do with nonwild() and putting it in your process and if you are in nonwild send (“null”) instead of attack. if you want it to always appear at the top you must also add all of the others(trade, follow) to the method you created (use a method because it keeps the process prettier) o.o i am not going to post how to do it because this is a learning enviornment but i gave you the necessary details to what you want to accomplish

Tells me almost nothing, still looking for an answer.

I’d rather have someone post whats wrong with my code than what was just posted to be quite honest. Or post theirs and an explanation.
[/quote]

No ones going to spoon-feed you get over it.[/quote]

Think before you speak. I’ve tried probably 20 different things, including !inwild, and none of them have worked, i’ve tried deleting it, none of it seems to work.

Read full topic
